Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee inadmissibility based on criminality and association with terrorist organization
Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Violent offense involving intent to harm
Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Individual with past membership in a proscribed organization (INLA)
Crimes.Victim_Status: Unknown, but offense involves intentional harm
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Membership in a terrorist organization (INLA), history of violent activities
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Opportunity to submit written representations in defense
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes, includes wounding with intent and other offenses
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient to establish grounds for inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, admissions, public designations of INLA as terrorist entity
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Accepted as credible by adjudicator and Minister
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No credibility issues raised; written submissions deemed adequate
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk due to terrorism links and violent criminal history
Crimes.Risk_Type: National security and public safety risk
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Possible targeted violence given nature of INLA activities
Crimes.Targeted_Individual: Police or state representatives (inferred from INLA context)
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: Immigration Act provisions including s. 46.01(1)(e)(ii), s. 27(2)(a), s. 19(1)(f)(iii)(B)
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Inadmissibility for membership in terrorist organization
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – immigration consequence, not criminal sentencing
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Request for oral hearing denied; process conducted via written submissions
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Administrative refugee determination followed by judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration officer and Minister of Immigration
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under the Charter and Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Compatibility with principles of fundamental justice under s. 7 of Charter

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee inadmissibility due to involvement in terrorism-related criminal activity
Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Member of Irish National Liberation Army (INLA)
Crimes.Victim_Status: Unspecified potential victims of planned attack
Crimes.Threat_Source: Organizational and individual ties to INLA
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Terrorist affiliation, planning of lethal violence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Right to make written submissions during inadmissibility assessment
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Extensive, including conspiracy and other violent crimes
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: Very high – direct link to planned homicide
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Adequate based on organizational membership and known activities
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Official records, intelligence, designation of INLA as terrorist group
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No challenge to truthfulness required; documentary basis accepted
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Continuing threat due to ideological commitment
Crimes.Targeted_Individual: Government officials, police, or rival factions
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian immigration law applying extraterritorial conduct
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter, Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Inadmissibility for association with terrorist organization
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Denial of oral hearing requested by applicant
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Citizenship and Immigration Canada, Federal Court
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Compliance with principles of fundamental justice

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility based on violent criminal record and terrorist links
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of force against police, membership in armed group
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Opportunity to respond in writing to allegations
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Multiple convictions including assault and resisting arrest
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Established through criminal records and organizational links
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Criminal history documents, INLA membership evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No credibility contest; factual basis uncontested
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Potential for re-engagement in anti-authority actions
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: Immigration Act provisions related to terrorism inadmissibility
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Lack of oral hearing despite request
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Administrative refugee screening and ministerial discretion
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review on fairness and constitutionality
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Fairness under s. 7 Charter and s. 2(e) Canadian Bill of Rights

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim denial over past criminal behavior and terrorism links
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Violation of right to fair hearing under Charter and Bill of Rights
Crimes.Governing_Law: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Based on written submissions and existing records
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show no danger to public interest
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: No oral testimony required; written evidence sufficient
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Principles of fundamental justice do not require oral hearings when no credibility issues exist
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and correctness depending on issue
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness and constitutional rights
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process met minimum standards of fairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Criminal record, INLA membership, public interest considerations
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Unfair process, lack of oral hearing
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Section 7 of Charter, Section 2(e) of Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities / reasonable grounds to believe
Crimes.Decision_Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Principles of fundamental justice under s. 7 Charter

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee ineligibility due to criminal background and terrorism association
Crimes.Threat_Source: Pattern of criminal behavior and extremist ties
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Repeat offending, combination with violent and terrorism-related crimes
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes – includes DUI, assault, resisting arrest
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: Moderate to high – reflects disregard for public safety
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Increased due to cumulative criminal history
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Potential for recidivism and broader threats
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter, Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship

Crimes.National_Security_Element: Direct link to proscribed terrorist group (INLA)
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: High – organization engaged in armed struggle and bombings
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Ongoing concern due to ideology and past actions
Crimes.Target_Entity: British state, security forces, political opponents
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Participation in or support of violent campaign
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: Active or passive participation unclear, but sufficient for inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Criminal records, intelligence reports, public listings
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether membership implies endorsement of terrorism
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency across sources, official designation of INLA
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: None raised regarding authenticity or relevance
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Compatibility with principles of fundamental justice
Crimes.Authority_Body: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – inadmissible person subject to removal

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim denial due to criminal history and terrorism association
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Right to fair hearing under s. 7 Charter and s. 2(e) Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Governing_Law: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Based on documented criminal record and INLA affiliation
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate no threat to public interest
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: No oral hearing needed where facts are documentary
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Fundamental justice does not mandate oral hearings if written process is adequate
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative interpretation
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Criminal convictions, INLA membership, public interest concerns
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Violation of procedural fairness and constitutional rights
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Section 7 of Charter, Section 2(e) of Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Decision_Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Principles of fundamental justice under s. 7 Charter
